newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila Central bank adjusts overnight rates.
newsitem.headline: Manila Central bank adjusts overnight rates.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank said on Thursday it lowered its overnight borrowing rate to 11.25 percent from 11.50 percent.
However, it raised its overnight lending rate to 13 percent from 12.65 percent.
"We're just basically realigning our rates at the moment," Central Bank Treasurer Sergio Edeza told Reuters.
"We's also be adjusting our term rates," he added.
The lowering of the Central Bank's overnight borrowing rate came four days after the 0.50 percentage-point increase in this rate to quell peso speculation.
The peso had been hit by fears of capital flight following stock market sales.
